column2: Construct an ontology focused on the following: homeless person. Provide it in valid Turtle/RDF format, excluding any extra text.
column3: ```turtle@prefix rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> .@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .@prefix xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#> .@prefix hl: <http://www.example.org/homeless/> .hl:HomelessPerson rdf:type rdfs:Class .hl:age rdf:type rdf:Property ;    rdfs:range xsd:integer ;    rdfs:domain hl:HomelessPerson .hl:gender rdf:type rdf:Property ;    rdfs:range xsd:string ;    rdfs:domain hl:HomelessPerson .hl:isVeteran rdf:type rdf:Property ;    rdfs:range xsd:boolean ;    rdfs:domain hl:HomelessPerson .hl:hasMentalIllness rdf:type rdf:Property ;    rdfs:range xsd:boolean ;    rdfs:domain hl:HomelessPerson .hl:durationOfHomelessness rdf:type rdf:Property ;    rdfs:range xsd:integer ;    rdfs:domain hl:HomelessPerson .hl:location rdf:type rdf:Property ;    rdfs:range xsd:string ;    rdfs:domain hl:HomelessPerson .hl:reasonForHomelessness rdf:type rdf:Property ;    rdfs:range xsd:string ;    rdfs:domain hl:HomelessPerson .```This ontology includes a class `HomelessPerson` and properties like `age`, `gender`, `isVeteran`, `hasMentalIllness`, `durationOfHomelessness`, `location`, and `reasonForHomelessness`. The ranges of these properties are `xsd:integer` for numerical values, `xsd:string` for text values, and `xsd:boolean` for true/false values. The domain for all these properties is `HomelessPerson`.
